description: Michael introduces the documentary crew to the office and pretends to be on a call with a big client.
Michael reenacts a Chris Rock comedy routine, offending the office.
Michael tasks Dwight with picking a healthcare plan while he tries to avoid the responsibility.
Michael tries to boost morale by joking about downsizing, which backfires immediately.
Michael prepares for the basketball game, convinced he will dominate the warehouse staff.
Michael frantically cleans the office to impress the purse girl.
Michael raps 'The Scarn' (from Threat Level Midnight) in his office.
Michael forwards inappropriate emails to the staff and gets in trouble with the IT guy.
Michael leaves early to sign papers for his condo, leaving the office unsupervised.
Ryan tries to do business school work at his desk while Michael distracts him.
Michael struggles with the decision of whom to fire on Halloween.
Jim moves Dwight's desk into the men's restroom.
The staff discovers Michael's screenplay, 'Threat Level Midnight'.
Jim pops Dwight's fitness orb with a pair of scissors.
Michael spots a man in a turban (the IT guy) and suspects he is a terrorist.
Michael gets a Christmas tree that is far too large for the office.
Michael packs for the booze cruise and practices his dance moves.
Michael burns his foot on a George Foreman grill.
Dwight investigates whether Oscar is actually sick or playing hooky.
Ryan works at the reception desk while Pam is on vacation.
Jan arrives at the office for the 'Women in the Workplace' seminar.
Michael goes to corporate in New York and accidentally reveals he slept with Jan.
Jim conditions Dwight to ask for an Altoid every time his computer restarts.
Michael shows a video of his childhood appearance on a puppet show.
Michael waits excitedly for donuts on his birthday.
Dwight investigates a half-smoked joint found in the parking lot.
Michael reads aloud from the conflict resolution complaints file.
Michael talks about the importance of charity for Casino Night.
Jim deals with the fallout of transferring to Stamford.
Michael prepares for the convention in Philadelphia.
The office has 'Movie Monday' and watches 'Varsity Blues'.
Michael learns about the death of his former boss, Ed Truck.
Dwight listens to 'Everybody Hurts' in his car.
Ryan tries to save his shoes from the melting asphalt.
Jim sends faxes to Dwight pretending to be 'Future Dwight'.
Andy Bernard introduces himself to the Scranton branch by singing.
Michael returns from the managers' retreat with 'news' about the merger.
Michael rides his old bicycle into the office for Christmas.
Michael is in a great mood after returning from Jamaica.
Jim pranks Michael by making his computer call him 'Boobz'.
Andy annoys everyone in the office with his ringtone.
Michael asks Jim about the bachelor party strippers.
Michael discusses his critical role in Phyllis's wedding.
Michael throws candy bars at Ryan's business school class.
Michael performs a magic trick with a straitjacket.
Roy attacks Jim in the office, and Dwight pepper sprays him.
Michael and Dwight bet on how many jellybeans are in a jar.
Jim impersonates Dwight. Bears. Beets. Battlestar Galactica.
Dwight punishes Jim for being late.
Michael asks the staff who would be the best replacement for him.
Michael gets a haircut before his interview at corporate.
Michael hits Meredith with his car in the parking lot.
Michael complains about ageism in the workplace.
The office is captivated by the DVD logo bouncing around the TV screen.
Michael watches 'The Devil Wears Prada' and acts like Meryl Streep.
Michael pitches his own ideas for the Dunder Mifflin commercial.
The Finer Things Club holds a meeting.
Michael misunderstands that it is Ryan's birthday, not his own.
Darryl beats Jim at ping pong, and Kelly trash talks Pam.
Michael tricks Jim and Pam into coming over for a dinner party.
Kevin and Andy fight to get their parking spaces back.
Michael gets gum stuck in his hair.
Michael puts his face in wet cement outside the office.
Jim tries to sell to a client on the golf course.
Michael sings 'Goodbye Toby' to the tune of 'Goodbye Stranger'.
The office weighs in for the corporate weight loss challenge.
Jim times Dwight to see how much company time he steals.
Dwight tests the durability of Jan's stroller.
Michael discovers the office has been robbed.
Three people dress up as the Joker for Halloween.
Michael pranks Holly with a fake marriage proposal.
Michael is excited about the international concierge in Winnipeg.
Michael screams 'NO GOD PLEASE NO' when he sees Toby is back.
Michael chokes on tiramisu.
Jim wraps Dwight's desk and chair in wrapping paper.
Michael runs past the speed radar to beat the office record.
Dwight follows a red wire from his computer to the telephone pole.
Dwight stages a fire drill that causes mass panic and Stanley's heart attack.
Michael prepares for his lecture circuit tour.
Dwight and Jim forgot Kelly's birthday.
Michael tries to act like a telemarketer.
Michael does a 'Knock Knock' KGB joke with Dwight.
Michael prepares for his 15th anniversary party.
Michael gets drunk and crawls around the office after quitting.
Kevin struggles to transfer calls as the new receptionist.
Michael, Pam, and Ryan toss cheese puffs into each other's mouths.
Dwight spins a sign for Michael Scott Paper Company.
Michael wakes up early to make deliveries for his new company.
Kevin brings in his famous chili and spills it all over the carpet.
Michael tries to get the office to dance in his disco cafe.
Michael falls asleep at his desk after eating a chicken pot pie.
Michael, Dwight, and Andy attempt 'Parkour' around the office.
Michael asks Oscar for advice on his colonoscopy.
Jim and Michael announce they are Co-Managers.
Pam's morning sickness causes a chain reaction of vomiting in the office.
Oscar tries to do a stereotypical Italian voice.
Michael introduces 'Blind Guy McSqueezy'.
The office turns the warehouse into a haunted house for children.
Dwight tries to rally the office with bagels.
Dwight fights himself in a martial arts demonstration.
Dwight introduces his 'Recyclops' character.
Andy and Michael talk baby talk to each other.
Michael waits impatiently for the Christmas tree.
Michael introduces 'Computron', a fake AI assistant.
Christian Slater explains the Sabre orientation in a video.
Michael calls the Olympic committee to clarify his reservation.
Dwight inspects Jim and Pam's house for mold.
Meredith arrives at the office on St. Patrick's Day.
Michael dives into a dumpster to find the new leads.
Michael does pushups to impress the office.
Kevin is forced to eat broccoli.
Michael tries to learn Spanish from audio tapes.
Jim and Pam communicate using Morse code to mess with Dwight.
Michael discusses his affair with the office.
Michael releases a video statement about the printer fires.
The office performs a Lip Dub to 'Nobody But Me'.
Dwight reenacts 'Pretty Woman' at the mall.
Andy sings a song about his play.
Dwight opens a daycare center in the building.
Oscar shows off his new bicycle.
The office tests what Stanley will and won't notice.
Dwight eats all the dried peaches at his desk.
The office watches the Scranton Strangler chase on TV.
Ryan tries to pitch WUPHF.com to the office.
Dwight attempts to use his feet for everyday tasks.
Jim and Dwight have a snowball fight.
Jim discovers Dwight's 'Knights of the Night' patrol group.
Michael meets David Brent (Ricky Gervais) outside the elevator.
Michael gets stranded at a gas station.
Darryl receives a condolence card for his grandmother.
Michael reviews the script for 'Threat Level Midnight'.
Todd Packer brings cupcakes to the office.
Michael tries to propose to Holly with fire.
Michael waits at a bar for his replacement, Deangelo Vickers.
Michael delivers the Dundie nominations to the staff.
Michael sits on the roof of the building.
Deangelo Vickers performs a juggling routine without balls.
Dwight leads the office in the Pledge of Allegiance.
Creed Bratton acts as the manager.
The office engages in 'Planking' around the workspace.
Kevin saves time by speaking in shorthand ('Why say lot word when few word do trick?').
The warehouse crew wins the lottery.
Dwight puts up billboards for Schrute Farms.
Erin struggles with her Halloween costume.
Dwight explains the 'Doomsday Device'.
Dwight grabs Pam's crotch thinking she is wearing an iPod.
The office prepares for the trip to Gettysburg.
Dwight opens a gym in the building.
Erin gets drunk at the Christmas party.
The office plays the 'Silent Game' to see who can be quiet the longest.
Jim fills Dwight's desk with meatballs.
Jim returns from jury duty.
Dwight suffers from appendicitis.
Dwight wakes up the team in Florida.
Dwight and Packer compete for the VP position.
Dwight prepares the team for the store opening.
Jim tries to warn Dwight about the store firing.
Nellie arrives and takes the manager's chair.
The office is forced to throw a party for Nellie.
Andy returns and finds Nellie in his office.
Andy crashes the fundraiser.
Jim and Dwight race to steal a client.
Dwight sets up a portrait studio.
Kevin tries to fix a turtle he ran over.
Pam creates a 'Chore Wheel' for the office.
Jim and Pam hire an actor friend (Randall Park) to pretend to be 'Asian Jim'.
Dwight makes popcorn on the work bus.
Dwight gets his head stuck in a carved pumpkin.
Andy learns his family has lost their fortune.
The men of the office grow mustaches for Movember.
Angela asks Dwight to do a favor for her.
Dwight prepares for a Pennsylvania Dutch Christmas.
Jim bites his lip repeatedly.
Darryl interviews for a job in Philadelphia.
Jim tries to leave for his daughter's recital.
Dwight interviews his friends for a job.
Pam finds her mural vandalized.
The couples try to fake arguments to get a discount.
Andy returns from his boat trip.
Dwight throws dirt into his siblings' faces at a funeral.
Phyllis listens to '50 Shades of Grey' audio book.
Dwight shoots Stanley with a bull tranquilizer.
The office competes in a paper airplane contest.
Andy quits his job to pursue acting.
Dwight tests his new assistant.
The documentary crew returns one year later.
